intro: Bulbinella triquetra var. trinervis, commonly known as the three-angled bulbinella, is a small, flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant features a short, rhizomatous growth habit with narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, appearing in clusters during the spring season. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils in open habitats.
